intro: Stephania ramuliflora, commonly known as the creeping mountain spinach, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by orange-red berries. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
